questions.text: Which of the following is an example of a vaccine used as a secondary level of prevention?

options.label: A
options.text: Hepatitis B vaccine

options.label: B
options.text: MMR (Measles, Mumps, Rubella) vaccine

options.label: C
options.text: BCG (Bacillus Calmette-Guérin) vaccine

options.label: D
options.text: Influenza vaccine

questions.text: A 2-year-old child is brought by his mother. During the consultation, it is revealed that the child has not received any vaccinations since birth due to the family's geographical isolation and lack of access to healthcare services. The healthcare worker is concerned about the child’s susceptibility to vaccine-preventable diseases and advises immediate initiation of the vaccination schedule. Based on this scenario, how would you classify this child’s immunization status?

options.label: A
options.text: Fully immunized

options.label: B
options.text: Completely immunized

options.label: C
options.text: Dropout

options.label: D
options.text: Left out

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines cannot be given to a pregnant woman?

options.label: A
options.text: Rabies vaccine

options.label: B
options.text: IPV

options.label: C
options.text: Rotavirus vaccine

options.label: D
options.text: Kyasanur Forest Disease Vaccine

questions.explanation:
Live Vaccines

Killed Vaccines

Injected in live, attenuated (weakened) form

Injected in killed form

A single dose is sufficient (except OPV)

Multiple doses are needed

Longer duration of immunity

Shorter duration of immunity

Contraindicated in pregnancy, radiation therapy, and severe symptomatic immunodeficiency.

It can be given during pregnancy

Examples:

Mnemonic - I love Chick EMBRYO

Live Influenza, Chickenpox (Varicella), Live JE vaccine, MR, BCG, Rotavirus, Yellow fever virus, OPV.

Others: Live plague vaccine

Examples:

Mnemonic: KILLED

KFD, IPV, Killed Influenza, Japanese Encephalitis (Killed), Dog bite-Rabies

Others · Killed Plague vaccine · Killed cholera vaccine

Reversion to virulence is possible.

Reversion to virulence is not possible.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is wrong with regard to administration of two live vaccines?

options.label: A
options.text: Do not administer both vaccines at the same site simultaneously.

options.label: B
options.text: Administer both vaccines at different sites simultaneously.

options.label: C
options.text: Administer both vaccines with a minimum interval of 3 weeks.

options.label: D
options.text: Administer both vaccines with a minimum interval of 2 weeks.

questions.correct_answer: D. Administer both vaccines with a minimum interval of 2 weeks.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about polysaccharide vaccines?

options.label: A
options.text: They are often combined with a toxoid component to enhance the immune response against toxins produced by bacteria.

options.label: B
options.text: Multiple immunizing agents are included in the vaccine.

options.label: C
options.text: More effective in children < 2 years

options.label: D
options.text: Polysaccharide based vaccines are available against S.pneumoniae, H.influenza b

questions.correct_answer: D. Polysaccharide based vaccines are available against S.pneumoniae, H.influenza b
questions.explanation:
Vaccine and Mechanism

Examples

Advantage / Disadvantage

Toxoid

(Option A)

Exotoxins produced by live organisms are used

Diphtheria, Tetanus, Anthrax

Highly efficacious

Highly safe

Protein vaccine

Specific proteins or peptides from the pathogen

Influenza vaccine (hemagglutinin and Neuraminidase), Acellular pertussis vaccine.

Less immunogenic

Conjugate vaccine

Polysaccharide antigen chemically linked to a protein recognized by Tcells.

Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine - PCV (used in NIS), Meningococcal.

Adv: More effective in children < 2 years (Option C)

D/A: Serotype specific

Recombinant Vaccine

Prepared by DNA technology.

Antigens are expressed on E. coli, yeast, and mammalian cells.

Hepatitis B, HPV, Cholera toxin B, Lyme disease

Adv: Safe

D/A: Less immunogenic and need an adjuvant to enhance efficiency

Combination Vaccine

(Option B)

More than one immunizing agent

MMR, DPT, Pentavalent

Overall reduction in adverse effects due to combination

questions.text: Which of the following statements is FALSE regarding the contraindications of vaccines?

options.label: A
options.text: Yellow fever vaccine can be given to pregnant women

options.label: B
options.text: DPT Vaccine is unsafe in children with Spina bifida

options.label: C
options.text: All live vaccines are contraindicated in patients on corticosteroids

options.label: D
options.text: All vaccines except MMR, measles, rubella & varicella are contraindicated in adults with symptomatic HIV

questions.correct_answer: B. DPT Vaccine is unsafe in children with Spina bifida

questions.text: A 7 y/o girl is brought to a makeshift medical camp that was set up following a massive earthquake 3 days ago. She has no prior history of vaccinations. The child was exposed to a confirmed case of measles two days ago. Which of the following would be your next step in helping the child?

options.label: A
options.text: Administer the measles vaccine immediately.

options.label: B
options.text: Administer typhoid and cholera vaccines first.

options.label: C
options.text: Administer OPV.

options.label: D
options.text: No vaccines are necessary at this time.

questions.correct_answer: A. Administer the measles vaccine immediately.

questions.text: Match the following vaccines with their well-known side effects: Vaccine Side effect a. Rotavirus 1. Inconsolable cry & convulsions b. BCG 2. Toxic Shock Syndrome c. Measles 3. Scar d. Pertussis 4. Intussusception
Which of the following is the diluent used for the Measles Rubella vaccine?

options.label: A
options.text: Normal Saline

options.label: B
options.text: Phosphate Buffer Solution

options.label: C
options.text: Distilled water/ Sterile Water

options.label: D
options.text: Cold Physiological saline

questions.text: You have been posted in a rural PHC where you just received a new batch of vaccines for the upcoming vaccination drive. You need to educate your team on the conditions that have to be fulfilled in order to reuse opened vaccine vials during the drive. Which of the following would you not suggest regarding the same?

options.label: A
options.text: The Vaccine Vial monitor has not reached the discard point.

options.label: B
options.text: An aseptic technique must be used to withdraw all doses.

options.label: C
options.text: Vaccines are stored strictly under an appropriate temperature (+6° C to +10° C) range during transportation and storage at cold chain point.

options.label: D
options.text: The expiry date should not have passed.

questions.correct_answer: C. Vaccines are stored strictly under an appropriate temperature (+6° C to +10° C) range during transportation and storage at cold chain point.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true based on thermolability of vaccines?

options.label: A
options.text: The most heat-sensitive vaccine is Hepatitis B.

options.label: B
options.text: The most freeze-sensitive vaccine is Pentavalent.

options.label: C
options.text: The loss of potency of vaccines due to exposure to heat or cold is permanent and cannot be regained.

options.label: D
options.text: The physical appearance of a damaged vaccine always changes.

questions.correct_answer: C. The loss of potency of vaccines due to exposure to heat or cold is permanent and cannot be regained.
questions.explanation:
Vaccines Sensitive to Heat

Vaccines Sensitive to Freezing

OPV

Hepatitis B

IPV

Pentavalent

Measles, MR

IPV

Rota

DPT

JE

DT

DPT

  

BCG

  

TT

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the Vaccine Vial Monitor (VVM) is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: The VVM is a heat-sensitive chemical indicator placed on the body of the vial, neck of the ampule, or cap of the vial.

options.label: B
options.text: The VVM records cumulative heat exposure of the vaccines through a gradual change in color.

options.label: C
options.text: If the inner square of the VVM is darker than the outer circle, the vaccine can still be used.

options.label: D
options.text: The VVM number is the time in days for the inner square to reach the colour indicating a discard point, if the vial is exposed to a constant temperature of 37°C.

questions.correct_answer: C. If the inner square of the VVM is darker than the outer circle, the vaccine can still be used.

questions.text: Which of the following steps is incorrect when conducting a shake test to check for vaccine vial damage due to freezing?

options.label: A
options.text: Take a vaccine vial you suspect may have been frozen and label it as the "Test" vial.

options.label: B
options.text: Freeze a control vial of the same antigen, manufacturer, and batch number at -20°C overnight, and label it as the "Frozen control vial."

options.label: C
options.text: Thaw the "Frozen control vial" by heating it gently.

options.label: D
options.text: Shake both the "Test" vial and the "Frozen control vial" together for 10-15 seconds, then place them side-by-side on a flat surface to observe sedimentation.

questions.correct_answer: C. Thaw the "Frozen control vial" by heating it gently.

questions.text: Which of the following diseases is not part of the Pan-India diseases covered under Mission Indradhanush?

options.label: A
options.text: Extra-pulmonary tuberculosis

options.label: B
options.text: Polio

options.label: C
options.text: Rotavirus diarrhea

options.label: D
options.text: Japanese encephalitis

questions.text: Which of the following is not included in the IT initiatives under Mission Indradhanush?

options.label: A
options.text: eVIN (Electronic Vaccine Intelligence Network)

options.label: B
options.text: ANMOL (Auxiliary Nurse Midwife Online)

options.label: C
options.text: SAFE-VAC (Surveillance and Actions for Events following Vaccination)

options.label: D
options.text: AEFI (Adverse Event Following Immunization)

questions.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE regarding the "Switch" from tOPV to bOPV in India?

options.label: A
options.text: The switch included the removal of wpv1 from the vaccine formulation.

options.label: B
options.text: The reason for the switch was the eradication of wpv3 in September 2015.

options.label: C
options.text: bOPV contains attenuated forms of wpv1 and wpv3.

options.label: D
options.text: IPV was introduced after the switch to compensate for the removal of wpv2 from the vaccine.

questions.correct_answer: C. bOPV contains attenuated forms of wpv1 and wpv3.
